title: 4 injured, 2 critically in Mount Oliver shooting
content:
MOUNT OLIVER, Pa. —
Four people, the youngest being 11 years old, were shot in Mount Oliver Friday night.
Officials at the scene say two kids, 11 and 13 years old, are in critical condition. A 16-year-old victim was shot in the foot. A fourth victim, a 31 year old, was grazed in the torso and has minor injuries.
Witnesses at the scene tell Pittsburgh's Action News 4 it was a drive-by shooting on Brownsville Road at Amanda Street. County police confirmed the shots were fired from a vehicle at the location.
A Rite Aid employee said she was on smoke break when a bullet went over her head.
"The concrete from the building hit my shirt and right above my head. The bullet went through the glass," said the employee who didn't want to be identified.
According to police, the two youngest victims remain in the hospital with non-life threatening injuries.
Anyone who say or heard anything related to the incident is asked to contact the Allegheny County Homicide Unit at 412-472-1300.
